revised_title: Roman Antiquities in Lincolnshire: Discoveries and Descriptions
tldr: The author, Abraham de la Pryme, shares his observations and findings of Roman antiquities in Lincolnshire, including a Roman pavement, roads, and other structures. He describes the course of the Roman High-way, or High Street, and its significance in the region. He also mentions the discovery of Roman coins, pottery, and other artifacts, as well as the foundations of old towns and settlements. The author's account provides valuable insights into the history and culture of Roman Britain.
